font-preview.useWorker.description: If enabled, VS Code will try to use a worker when loading the font. Fonts may load faster, but you may also see a small shift while the font loads. Disable this setting if you notice any weird behavior.

font-preview.showGlyphWidth.description: Show the glyph's width in the cell.

font-preview.showGlyphIndex.description: Show the index of the glyph in the left corner of the cell.

font-preview.sampleTextPaths.title: Sample Text Paths
font-preview.sampleTextPaths.markdownDescription:
Paths to custom sample text YAML files. **NOTE**: A large number of sample _may_ cause performance issues. The YAML file must have the following format:

```yaml
# The name of the sample text (required)
id: Sample Title
# A citation stating where this text came from (optional)
source: Sample source
# Determines if this is a right-to-left language (optional)
rtl: false
# The text to display.
# This must be an array of strings (required)
paragraphs:
  - Hello, World!
```

font-preview.defaultSampleTextId.markdownDescription: The name of the default sample text to load. For user defined YAML file samples, this comes from the `id` property.

font-preview.defaultLogLevel.description: The default logging level for the output window.

font-preview.showSampleTextErrors.description: Show a warning notification if the extension detects an invalid or missing sample text file. If disabled, errors can still be viewed in the output window.

font-preview.retainTabPosition.markdownDescription: If enabled, newly opened font files will start on the tab of the last font file. Note that this setting will override the default tab setting `#font-preview.defaultTab#`.
